note.p: Birth: Whittingehame, East Lothian, Scotland (25 July 1848)
Death: Fisher's Hill, his brother's house near Woking, Surrey (19 March 1930)

Career: MP for Hertford (1874-1885); Private Secretary to his uncle, the 3rd Marquess of Salisbury (FRS 1869) (1878-1880); Privy Councillor (1885); President, Local Government Board (1885-1886); Leader of the House of Commons; Prime Minister (1902-1905); Foreign Secretary (1916-1919)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1930 vol 129 pp xv-xxxiii, plate, by Rayleigh
Proc Roy Soc Series B 1931 vol 107 pp iv-xxii, plate, by Rayleigh
References: R V Jones, 'Alfred Ewing and "Room 40"' in NR 1979-80 vol 34 pp 65-90
Vanity Fair 01 December 1880, 24 September 1887, 30 November 1893 (group), 01 December 1898, 27 January 1910
